definition: to have no way out/to have no alternative
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
see 万俟[Mo4 qi2]
sort/kind/class/way/manner
see 般樂|般乐[pan2 le4]
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
how can one help

sentences.english: Have no alternative under, this passenger is forced to abandon the journey.
sentences.chinese: 万般无奈之下，这名旅客只好放弃行程。

sentences.english: We had no choice but to bring him back to China.
sentences.chinese: 万般无奈，我们只好把非送回中国。

sentences.english: Helplessly, Chen had to took her back home to receive treatment.
sentences.chinese: 万般无奈，陈勇军只好把王莉接回家治疗。

sentences.english: Desperately, he decided to try to run upstairs and warn the family.
sentences.chinese: 他万般无奈，决定设法跑上楼，通知房主。

sentences.english: Chen Hao has no alternative come to overpass sing for a living, make chummage and living cost.
sentences.chinese: 陈浩万般无奈来到过街天桥卖唱，挣房租和生活费。

definition: to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
without any better option/to have to/to be forced to
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
to have no alternative/to be helpless
to have no alternative but to/to be obliged to
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
to entreat piteously/to implore
to turn over in one's mind (idiom); to think through from different angles/to ponder
to suffer/fig. reluctantly
abuse of authority/tyrannical abuse
to coax and pester (idiom)/to wheedle/to cajole
to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
to make threats and promises
